::: {.cell hash='spatial-fitting_cache/epub/unnamed-chunk-1_b0c2e5c78916e49503fa7950a564aa61'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidyverse)
theme_set(theme_bw(base_size = 16)) # set global theme
```
:::




## Dataset

The hypothetical data below shows a gradient for the number of lesions counted at varying distances in meters from the source. Let's create two vectors, one for the distances $x$ and the other for the lesion count $Y$, and then a data frame by combining the two vectors.




::: {.cell hash='spatial-fitting_cache/epub/unnamed-chunk-2_6a6d47e99729e1283b9c12c2edcee5d3'}

```{.r .cell-code}
# create the two vectors
x <- c(0.8, 1.6, 2.4, 3.2, 4, 7.2, 12, 15.2, 21.6, 28.8)
Y <- c(184.9, 113.3, 113.3, 64.1, 25, 8, 4.3, 2.5, 1, 0.8)
grad1 <- data.frame(x, Y) # create the dataframe
grad1 # show the gradient
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
      x     Y
1   0.8 184.9
2   1.6 113.3
3   2.4 113.3
4   3.2  64.1
5   4.0  25.0
6   7.2   8.0
7  12.0   4.3
8  15.2   2.5
9  21.6   1.0
10 28.8   0.8
```
:::
:::




## Visualize the gradient




::: {.cell hash='spatial-fitting_cache/epub/fig-fit_grad1_20e5b96f8fb19fe0d724a63f5d5d4777'}

```{.r .cell-code}
grad1 |> 
  ggplot(aes(x, Y))+
  geom_point()+
  geom_line()+
  labs(y = "Lesion count",
       x = "Distance (m)")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![Hypothetical gradient of lesion count over distances from the inoculum source](spatial-fitting_files/figure-epub/fig-fit_grad1-1.png){#fig-fit_grad1}
:::
:::




## Linear regression

A linear regression model is fitted to the transformed variables according to the model. The higher the coefficient of determination, the better is the fit of the model to the data.

### Exponential model




::: {.cell hash='spatial-fitting_cache/epub/unnamed-chunk-4_e85c51e03e00361f26307e492810a8c2'}

```{.r .cell-code}
reg_exp <- lm(log(Y) ~ x, data = grad1)
summary(reg_exp)$r.squared
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 0.8776612
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='spatial-fitting_cache/epub/fig-fit_grad2_0413f512574a96b799d08e23e3072d1e'}

```{.r .cell-code}
grad1 |> 
  ggplot(aes(x, log(Y)))+
  geom_point()+
  geom_line()+
  geom_abline(slope = coef(reg_exp)[[2]], intercept = coef(reg_exp)[[1]])+
 labs(y = "Log of Lesion count",
       x = "Distance (m)")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![Fit of the exponential model to the log of lesion count over distances from the inoculum source](spatial-fitting_files/figure-epub/fig-fit_grad2-1.png){#fig-fit_grad2}
:::
:::




### Power law model 




::: {.cell hash='spatial-fitting_cache/epub/unnamed-chunk-6_5c85ba3e3ccc98b1de576de380d2dbb7'}

```{.r .cell-code}
reg_p <- lm(log(Y) ~ log(x), data = grad1)
summary(reg_p)$r.squared
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 0.962132
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='spatial-fitting_cache/epub/fig-fit_grad3_9ce2daa0b490e2d0844db5159c539906'}

```{.r .cell-code}
grad1 |> 
  ggplot(aes(log(x), log(Y)))+
  geom_point()+
  geom_line()+
  geom_abline(slope = coef(reg_p)[[2]], intercept = coef(reg_p)[[1]])+
 labs(y = "Log of Lesion count",
       x = "Log of distance")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![Fit of the power law model to the log of lesion count over log of the distance from the inoculum source](spatial-fitting_files/figure-epub/fig-fit_grad3-1.png){#fig-fit_grad3}
:::
:::




### Modified power law model




::: {.cell hash='spatial-fitting_cache/epub/unnamed-chunk-8_05d74016967f0c30446f0172c286d13d'}

```{.r .cell-code}
reg_pm <- lm(log(Y) ~ log(x + 0.4), data = grad1)
summary(reg_pm)$r.squared
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 0.9742072
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='spatial-fitting_cache/epub/fig-fit_grad4_a342383dbbe5e1951fe1208a0e87640b'}

```{.r .cell-code}
grad1 |> 
  ggplot(aes(log(x+0.4), log(Y)))+
  geom_point()+
  geom_line()+
  geom_abline(slope = coef(reg_pm)[[2]], intercept = coef(reg_pm)[[1]])+
 labs(y = "Log of Lesion count",
       x = "Log of distance + 0.4 (m)")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![Fit of the modified power law model to the log of lesion count over log + 0.4 of the distances from the inoculum source](spatial-fitting_files/figure-epub/fig-fit_grad4-1.png){#fig-fit_grad4}
:::
:::




Based on the (highest) coefficient of determination, the modified power law provided the best fit. The graphs for the fitted models confirm this conclusion.
